channel.title: GraphSys '25 on GraphSys
channel.description: Recent content in GraphSys '25 on GraphSys

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description:
Aligned with Euro-Par, the premier European conference addressing all facets of parallel and distributed processing, GraphSys'25 is the first Workshop on Serverless, Extreme-Scale, and Sustainable Graph Processing Systems. GraphSys is a cross-disciplinary meeting venue focusing on state-of-the-art and emerging (future) graph processing systems.

The workshop is designed for researchers, practitioners, and students interested in sustainable graph processing. Participants from academia, industry, (government) research labs, and nonprofit organizations are encouraged to attend and contribute to the GraphSys discussions and collaborations.

item.title: Supporting Projects and Initiatives
item.description:
The GraphSys workshop is linked to the Graph-Massivizer project funded by the Horizon Europe research and innovation program of the European Union for the period 2023-2026. The project aims to develop a high-performance, scalable, gender-neutral, secure, and sustainable platform for massive graph processing.

Organizer

Graph-Massivizer

Graph-Massivizer researches and develops a high-performance, scalable, and sustainable platform for information processing and reasoning based on the massive graph representation of extreme data.
